lexUnit.name: tear.v

document.description: Chapter 14 of The Hound of the Baskervilles
document.name: Hound-Ch14

lexUnit.definition: FN: FN: take away a piece from a larger piece by tearing

sentence.text: Drago tore tortured notes from the lamentarion , Tumblejack pranced and roared , Flittern made his instrument groan and thunder , while Malengin was a blur behind the drums , chips of bone flying off his skin-hammers .
Often Minoan worshippers tore branches or boughs from a sacred tree and venerated them on altars or planted them in the sockets between sacral horns .
Balberith tore a section of reinforced steel roof from the military vehicle and glared down through the hole .
Eventually I managed to find a page torn from a local bus timetable which showed the Province of Parma .
He thought the jerk would tear his head from his shoulders .
Lorrimer tore himself from his grasp and stood upright .
With a sob she tore her mouth from his .
He 'd probably tear them out anyway .
The Ixyphalians will tear our bowels out and hang us with them .
The whole must be torn out by the roots .
As they watched , it tore out Hugo Baskerville 's throat .
Tearing out a sheet from his notebook , de Castelnau scribbled down his historic order that Verdun must be defended at all costs on the Right Bank , and handed it to PÃ©tain .
He tore flesh from his grandmother , but tossed it aside .
The dog tore his lead out of her hand and raced along the bank , barking .
There is frequently a temptation never to tear oneself away from the hotel .
We tore away his collar , and Holmes breathed a prayer of gratitude when we saw that there was no sign of a wound and that the rescue had been in time .

Two firefighters were injured while fighting the fire and were transported to Erie County Medical Center , '' said Division Fire Chief Thomas Ashe who also said that sections of the kitchen wall at the back of the house had to be torn out to stop the fire from spreading through the walls .
